Dispute_Type: Regulatory dispute over religious broadcasting rights
Legal_Issue: Whether plaintiffs have grounds to seek injunctive relief and a broadcasting license under constitutional and statutory provisions
Governing_Law: Canadian Charter of Rights and Freedoms
Decision_Outcome: Motion dismissed due to procedural defects
Burden_of_Proof: On plaintiffs to demonstrate grounds for relief and compliance with procedural requirements
Legal_Rule: Plaintiffs must comply with procedural requirements such as notifying attorneys general under s. 57 of the Federal Court Act
Procedural_Issue: Failure to notify attorneys general under s. 57 of the Federal Court Act
Grounds_for_Claim: Alleged violation of constitutional rights by broadcasting regulations
Outcome_on_Merits: Not reached; case dismissed on procedural grounds
Judicial_Review_Outcome: Plaintiffs granted leave to amend and refile
Procedural_Fairness_Assessment: Plaintiffs had opportunity to be heard but failed to meet formal notice requirements
Key_Evidence_Considered: Nature of regulatory actions, seizure of equipment, and lack of procedural compliance
Legal_Framework: Constitutional and statutory framework governing broadcasting and federal court procedures
Applicant_Challenge: Seeking injunctive relief and broadcasting license
Legal_Rule_Source: Federal Court Act, s. 57; Canadian Charter of Rights and Freedoms
Standard_of_Proof: Balance of probabilities for procedural compliance and jurisdictional claims
Defendant_Response: Plaintiffs failed to meet procedural prerequisites for filing
Outcome: Dismissal of motion with leave to refile upon correction of procedural errors
Remedy_Sought: Restoration of broadcasting rights, return of seized equipment, licensing approval
Resolution_Mechanism: Judicial determination with option for amendment and refiling
Claimant_Status: Plaintiffs seeking regulatory and constitutional relief
Legal_Provision_Cited: Federal Court Act, Broadcasting Act, Radiocommunication Act, Canadian Charter of Rights and Freedoms
Grounds_for_Inadmissibility_or_Allegatio: Failure to comply with procedural requirements under federal statute
Applicable_Process: Federal court litigation process requiring notice to government parties
Pending_Relief_or_Application: Leave to amend and refile application
Jurisdiction: Federal jurisdiction over broadcasting and constitutional matters
Governing_Rule: Federal Court Act, Broadcasting Act, Radiocommunication Act, Canadian Charter of Rights and Freedoms
